subject: Economics
title: Why Are Some Countries Rich and Others Poor?
description: A 60-second lesson on Why Are Some Countries Rich and Others Poor?.

hook.text: The average American earns $65,000 a year. The average Burundian earns $240.

buildup.text: Economists have proposed hundreds of explanations: geography, culture, colonialism, institutions, trade, luck.

discovery.text: No single factor explains development. It's a web.

twist.text: South Korea and Ghana had identical GDPs in 1960. Today, South Korea's is 16x higher.

climax.text: Development isn't destiny. It's the product of choices, institutions, and a fair amount of historical luck.

punchline.text: Poor countries aren't poor by nature. They were made poor.

quiz.question: What does the comparison of South Korea and Ghana in 1960 demonstrate?
options: Countries with similar starting points can diverge dramatically based on policy choices and institutions
